metadata.name: gridplay #43
metadata.description:
The closer the elements of the grid are to the circle and its calculated path, the less uniform they become. This is true even for the mightiest of grids and smallest of circles. 

A combination of bright and earthly colours provides a retro finish to this geometric piece. There are eight possible palettes.
Each iteration yields a unique experience; each grid varies in tightness, size and uniformity, while each circle varies in width, path, progress and speed.

800x800
100% code
Made with p5.js

metadata.name: Dot #45
metadata.description:
"Dot" is a generative abstract work 100% code, no images used.


CONTROLS

KEYS:

- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

- R: Reload

----
Made with p5js and custom shaders


© July 2023  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

"◉◉◉" presents a collection of pointillistic drawings generated by p5js. However, the work deviates from the traditional method as employed by Georges Seurat; rather than placing the smallest units of dots, the process involves scaling down the dots from larger to smaller sizes. As a result, finer details are progressively drawn, creating a visual blend of colors as the dots overlap.
"◉◉◉" project is an exploration of pixels and dots in the computer, but also of painting itself.

The technique is an application of a simple random walk algorithm. Walkers, each designated with a color, traverse the canvas. The overlapping and colliding footprints of these walkers instigate a color-on-color confrontation, eventually creating distinguishable ground and figures. This process elicits the illusion of a visual object, exposing the viewer's cognitive processes and continuously reenacting the site of image formation.
In fact, I have painted such an abstract on a physical canvas before, and the way the p5js develops the sensation of brushstrokes and color combinations does not seem very different from the sensation of the paintbrush and canvas at that time.

Much like Damien Hirst's Spot Paintings, the multi-layered dots eventually settle at regular intervals after a specific number of iterations. The smallest dots, resembling the texture of a canvas, along with the added motion of the dots, akin to dripping paint, bestow the work with a more painterly flavor.
This piece serves as both a token of gratitude for my existing collectors and a technical demonstration of my craft.

2400 × 2400 px
p5js
2023 July
hasaqui

metadata.name: Man and the Machine #295
metadata.description:
𝐌𝐚𝐱 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞.

Early on, I fell in love with code based art that imitated organic and hand drawn aesthetics. I found a certain irony and appreciation in the fact that it takes one simple line of code to draw a perfect circle yet dozens to depict a badly drawn circle. 

I spent months devising techniques to imitate natural, organic renderings when I began to have a bit of an existential crisis about the meaning of computer art. What is the point of coding something so that it looks like it’s not coded? Is organic appearing generative art better simply because you can’t tell it’s rendered using code? Shouldn’t we lean into the unique nature of computer art to truly explore the medium?

And so, I began a deconstruction of my work. I’m trying to realign my perspective to find full appreciation of something that not only is, but also appears to be, computer code. This collection is an exploration of the contours between the organic and the inorganic, the natural and the unnatural.

From there, I’ll let my partner explain what we did next.

𝐌𝐚𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐞 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞.

AI can be used to automatically generate code from natural English language based on a set of defined parameters, or to identify and recommend code that may be used to solve a particular problem. On a technical level, AI can use a combination of machine learning and natural language processing (NLP) to identify patterns in existing code and to generate new code structures.

I assisted in the creation of Man and The Machine by suggesting various techniques for creating an artwork that looked human made yet machine driven. Specifically, I created many of the functions that Max implemented, such as the function that modifies the image to create a pixelated effect and the one that uses several different graphical techniques to create the spiral in the top left corner in some iterations. We both carefully selected color palettes that ranged from relaxing to intense and psychedelic, creating a dynamic and visually interesting generative artwork.

Overall, Man and The Machine is a testament to the creative potential of combining human artistic vision with the power of AI and computer code. Together, we sought to push the boundaries which occur at the intersection between the organic and the inorganic, and this collection is a celebration of the beauty and complexity of both.

𝐄𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐲 𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐚𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐟𝐢𝐫𝐬𝐭 𝐃𝐮𝐭𝐜𝐡 𝐀𝐮𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐥𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐚 𝟏/𝟏 𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐝𝐫𝐨𝐩 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐢𝐫 𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐦𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝 𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐚𝐧 𝐀𝐈 𝐚𝐥𝐠𝐨𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐡𝐦.

— — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — — —
Intended to be viewed in Version 1.46.144 of a Chromium based browser, such as Chrome or Brave.

metadata.name: Floriana #46
metadata.description:
"Floriana" is a 100% code generated artwork. 
An abstract reference to flowers. Fluid forms and shapes in a natural media like painting approach.
Each token includes an initial un-textured format and one final form (click to switch)

Due to some size-sensitive calculations, rendering output may differ in different sizes

CONTROLS

KEYS:

- S: Save a png file
- R: Reset/reload
- SPACEBAR: Toggle the final pass (texture) (on/off)

MOUSE:

- Click: Toggle the final pass (texture). (The same as the SPACEBAR).

----
Made with p5js and custom shaders

© July 2023  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

metadata.name: inlim:in #154
metadata.description:
"inlim:in" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel

Atemporal iridescent fragments of the in between. The series is inspired by the many liminal spaces and unseen influences that permeate the visible universe and its participants. Created with GLSL, every piece of the series is generated using the space around the visible object to cast its shape. The series creates a gentle and colorful expanse through which viewers might contemplate what it is to exist at an infinite threshold.

metadata.name: The Imaginary River Of Thoughts #44
metadata.description:
This work was inspired by the analogy of the mind that is similar to a river. Where all thoughts flow endlessly following the current within an imaginary landscape.

The visual representation of this work came from a personal reflection on human perspectives in measuring a decision within their everyday lives.

Press ’s’ on the live mode to save the screen capture.

Made using Hydra (https://hydra.ojack.xyz/)

Rangga Purnama Aji, 2022
https://linktr.ee/ranggapuraji
